pullRequest.body:
Use `SubmodulesRingBasis` to put a topology on the finite adeles.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Remark: when this work was WIP and depended on other PRs it was #13703 (with no reviewer comments). Now all the PRs it depended on are merged, I merged master, it picked up a conflict, and I somehow messed up resolving it, with github reporting hundreds of changed files (edit: the problem was that I merged master after a dependent PR was squash-merged, and I had my git config set to "rebase when pulling by default"). So I've opened this, a new PR with the same material.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [ae4a748d58](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14176/commits/ae4a748d58d3f7dcaa77cdeff338fb9412974814)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ adicCompletion.mul_nonZeroDivisor_mem_adicCompletionIntegers`
`+ coe_mem_adicCompletionIntegers`
`+ exists_finiteIntegralAdele_iff`
`+ instance : Algebra R (FiniteAdeleRing R K)`
`+ instance : CoeFun (FiniteAdeleRing R K)`
`+ instance : IsScalarTower R K (FiniteAdeleRing R K)`
`+ instance : TopologicalSpace (FiniteAdeleRing R K)`
`+ intValuationDef_zero`
`+ mul_nonZeroDivisor_mem_finiteIntegralAdeles`
`+ not_mem_adicCompletionIntegers`
`+ submodulesRingBasis`
`+ valuation_eq_intValuationDef`
`+ valuedAdicCompletion_eq_valuation`
`+ valuedAdicCompletion_eq_valuation'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

:v: kbuzzard can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10123178412/job/27996156819)
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10133337268/job/28018391236)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10133337268/job/28018391328)

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+
Can you add `IsScalarTower R K (FiniteAdeleRing R K)` using `IsScalarTower.of_algebraMap_eq'`?
Do you plan to do It in this PR?
Oh sorry, that move had taken place :-) It has to go after the algebra instance.
Maybe use `example` so that it doesn't break later.

```suggestion
    rfl
```

This instance should be found via `One.instNonempty` right? Do we need this?
Even if we do, it probably doesn't belong here.
You're right, it can be deleted.

```suggestion
open Classical nonZeroDivisors Multiplicative Additive

open scoped algebraMap -- coercion from R to FiniteAdeleRing R K
open scoped DiscreteValuation
```
This is a general lemma right? Nothing adele-specific. So I guess it can move to the file on adic completions?
Yes, R is global and K_v is local and we're just saying that we can clear a local denominator with a global element. I'll move it.
Moved to the adic completion file.

```suggestion
  Valuation.extendToLocalization_apply_map_apply ..
```
Just because it is nicer
Can you find a more descriptive name?
I've gone for `adicCompletion.mul_nonZeroDivisor_mem_adicCompletionIntegers`. What do you think?
Here `R` and `K` can be implicit.
ooh good catch! Thanks!
Same as above.
`mul_nonZeroDivisor_mem_finiteIntegralAdeles` ?
Are we missing a `rfl` lemma here?

`S` is a local definition `let S := {v | a v  adicCompletionIntegers K v}` and I'm just changing `a v  adicCompletionIntegers K v` to `v  S`. But `change` is a bit of a code smell so I rewrote the proof to avoid it.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: topology on ring of finite adeles.
